history.content:
Written homeworks this semester are generally long and challenging, and electronic/written homeworks were generally released with no advance notice and short turnaround times from release to due date. That has been the major gripe this semester. 

Because some students this semester complained about the scheduling and some concerns about the efficacy of the electronic homeworks [which from being in the class now, they're only useful for conceptual learning, and I don't think are all that useful in terms of practice for the exams which are on a different class of difficulty completely]-----the course staff told us a few weeks ago that for future semesters, they were debating flattening the homework structure to go from the mixture of written and electronic homeworks to only weekly written homeworks. 

Because this generally would mean more homework difficulty (because the written homeworks are more difficult than the electronic ones), this is the source of a possible workload increase for future iterations of CS188. 

____________

It may also be because this is a radically different semester, but this semester's midterm average was 10 percentage points lower than last semester's midterm average. This matters because 188 is graded on fixed scales, not on a curve.

children.subject: Oh yea that'd be great! Well from what I heard, it was mostly MC hws assigned that while tedious, were super helpful, coding projects that aren't terrible, and written hw sprinkled in every couple of weeks that was much more challenging and more time consuming than the MC hws. This doesn't sound like a bad workload, but now I'm hearing that it'll change to weekly written hw similar to that of CS70 and EECS 126/127. This sounds much more difficult and time consuming than the previous iterations of the class that I have heard about

I think your general idea about what the class is like will probably hold true next semester as well. I'm not sure what future iterations will consist of (as I'll be graduating big sad). I think the rumor that CS188 workload has gone up is wrt even further back iterations of the course, before written hws were ever a thing. Those were created to help bridge some of the gaps between understanding lectures/MC hws to more difficult applications like the kinds that show up on exams (bc damn those exams were hard when I took it even though the HWs were more straightforward). Still think its a good class and lots of fun bc pacman and great professors
Thank you so much for your response! I'll definitely consider it more for next semester!

Hmm I guess this depends also on what you originally thought the workload was so I can better understand what's changed. Student response above is pretty good, as there's written hw in lieu of gradescope MC a few times during the semester. I don't think its gone up drastically, though this semester is hectic af so maybe the coronavirus crisis has also impacted effective workload. I can answer from both a student and staff perspective if that helps, as long as you're comfortable with sharing what you mean by low vs high workload :)

With that being said, 188 is a great class and I'm not biased at all

history.content: How true is this and how much is it going up by?
history.subject: I heard CS 188 workload is going up
